body.name: Taken by the Major: An Age Gap Valentine's Day Romance (Alpha Billionaire)

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love Love Loved it!
reviews.reviewText: Such a great book, I truly did not want it to end. Tate and Kenzie had some ups and downs but the love was there from the beginning. Ruby brought so much life to this story as well. One thing this book had was tones of PTSD of disabled veterans, and as a parent of one, my heart swelled with the attention to detail Ms. Gray provided (however minor) on that issue. I can not say enough good things about this story and highly highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The good, the bad and the ugly. Tate has just retired from the service. He has moved to a small town where he has inherited some land (house + barn + workshop). Tate no longer has to work because of his inheritance. On his way to the hardware store he almost hits someone on a skateboard. That’s his first introduction to Ruby. Ruby has a little sass to her, a little sarcasm but right now she has a broken wrist. Tate is a take charge kind of guy. He is taking her to the ER. At the ER Tate needs to call Ruby’s sister Kenzie. Kenzie is her guardian. When Tate meets Kenzie he feels something - tingles, a spark, a connection something he has never felt before. It’s going to get very interesting! Does Kenzie feel it? Does Ruby notice? This story is filled with emotions - caring, tenderness, sadness, playfulness, deception, passion, romance and the ultimate - love. A complete story filled with everything you would want. I really enjoyed this story there was so much happening with the characters you just want them to succeed! It’s good!.I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Taken by the major
reviews.reviewText: This a cute story about two broken people who meet at when they needed it most and fall in love and future family

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Wanted to love it
reviews.reviewText: I honestly felt like this book was lacking in certain ways, I loved where the author wanted to take me as a reader, and the emotions were definitely conveyed. I just thought that there could be more between the MCs and the details that went into their story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Emotional with manipulation, ptsd and loss
reviews.reviewText: Kenzie lost both her parents at 19 and became the legal guardian to her 8 yr old sister Ruby. 5 years later she’s struggling to make ends meet. She is constantly harassed by her father’s friend Mac, who “helped her” after her parents death. What he really did was manipulate her into bad financial decisions with the inheritance so she would be dependent on him and pressured her to marry him, which she refused. Her boss at the fast food restaurant refused to help her when Mac showed up harrasing her and he constantly held her job over her head. Tate was an Army Major who had no real relationship with his father. When his father died Tate was left a small fortune and several properties. One of which was in the small tow Kenzie lived in. He met her after Ruby wiped out on her skateboard in front of Tate and he rushed her to the hospital. Kenzi is very independent and won’t ask for help after dealing with Max but the connection between her and Tate is instant. They start seeing each other and he offer for Ruby to work for him helping clean out the workshop on his property building a connection with her as well. One of his soldiers comes to stay and when his PTSD gets to crisis mode Tate ends up yelling at The girls to keep them away and get Allen help and not having the time to explain. There is a lot of emotional baggage they each have and it’s a struggle to get everything figured out. Definitely have a few tissues lying around for this one!.I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Soldiering into Love
reviews.reviewText: When Kenzie becomes an adult and parent overnight after the passing of her parents and happily raising her younger sister, Ruby. Kenzie has become a pro on how to make their money work and have learned to live on bare minimum standards on their own. When a family after offers his help all he does is give her bad advice then tries to take advantage of her by forcing marriage. When Major Tate retires from the army he finds himself at one of his father’s home and slowly learns how to live as a civilian in a small town with good childhood memories. Ruby gets hurt while skateboarding and Tate avoiding hitting her in his truck only to feel responsible and getting her help in the ER. Tate has an unbelievable reaction to Kenzie and wants nothing but to help and be there for her and Ruby. They set off on their journey with those out to cause trouble, misunderstandings, incredible chemistry. It’s beautiful to see how Tate takes in a fellow soldier needing guidance and help with PTSD. Being wealthy and with a heart of gold Tate has a struggle to get Kenzie to see him as the man for her and all the good that can come to her and Ruby! I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Retired Army Major, FMC Guardian of Younger Sister, Swoon-worthy MMC with Great Side Characters!
reviews.reviewText: The is an age gap romance of former Army Major Tate and Kenzie. Kenzie has been taking care of her younger sister since her parents died when she was nineteen and Kenzie was eight years old. Now about 5 years later, Kenzie is doing the best she can to care for Ruby and working at a fast food restaurant and trying to explain life to a 13 year old Ruby. Complicating their situation, is the unwanted attention of a friend of her father’s named Mac who constantly harasses Kenzie while she is at work. Enter Major Tate… He is recently retired from the Army and ended up in Flat Rock. Tate is now pretty wealthy after being left an inheritance from his father than included a house in Flat Rock.The meet cute between Kenzie and Tate happens when Ruby breaks her wrist skateboarding and falls in front of Tate’s truck. There is a cute “stranger danger” scene but ultimately Tate comes to the rescue taking Ruby to the hospital and contacting Kenzie.The way this story unfolds is great. The side characters make this story even more compelling and how Kenzie and Tate navigate their feelings while staying true to themselves is really well written. I am giving this story a rare 5 stars and adding it to my reread list for sure!!.I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was an amazing book. It was heart felt and hoping she gets her happily after. They meet a lot and things starts to happen, fab read

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Really liked Kenzie and Tate.Ruby and Allen were lovely, too.Mac and will were well done.If I had a complaint, it would be that there wasn't enough bonding with Kenzie and Tate. But that's perhaps that I liked them so much I would have liked more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: What age gap? He is younger than the guy who fancies her? I didn’t get into it, I quit at 30%
